ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] Thanks
ygData.msgSnippet: 1. Someone else can explain it probably much better than I can but what I think you re talking about is the bar that s showing your connection.  The one that
ygData.messageBody:
1. Someone else can explain it probably much better than I can but what I think you're talking about is the bar that's showing your connection. The one that if it goes to you're zero, you're heading for your desktop. ;-) You can toggle it off and on with F11 if you get tired of seeing it.

2. Sites? There's a whole host of them. These are a few I use.

Good general sites:
http://everquest.allakhazam.com/
http://eq.castersrealm.com/
http://eqvault.ign.com/
http://www.everlore.com/

A good newbie faq
http://pub57.ezboard.com/ftheeverquestnewbiezonefrm5.showMessage?topicID=9.topic

Ranger site:
http://interealms.com/ranger/

If you're interested in Tradeskills:
http://www.eqtraders.com/
http://www.geocities.com/shadowknight57/
http://members.bellatlantic.net/~ewj/fletchguide/index.htm

Those will get you started at least along with the links they provide. And I'm sure there are members here that have other ones too. There are also usually at least one really good server site per server. At least I know there is for Mith Marr and Bristlebane...the two servers I play on. Good luck and happy hunting. Welcome to Norrath (that Evercrack state of mind. ;-)

Piper

----- Original Message -----
From: quiller64
To: theeverquesttavern@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, May 26, 2002 1:35 AM
Subject: [The EverQuest Tavern] Thanks


Thanks for responding to my new to online gaming post

I picked up the trilogy package, started this afternoon and 9 hours
later can see why is referred to as Evercrack. Started as a wood elf
ranger. 2 questions:
1. On the main screen middle right is a green bar with a number, a
percentage, a second percentage, another number (always changing,
what is it ? I couldn't find it in the manual.

2. Also any recommendations on sites/guide for a good EQ lingo
glossary.

Thanks Again
